creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
inscribed:
Initialed in plate, lower left: P / AME [ligatured]

Signed in plate, lower right corner: • H • cock excu • 

Inscribed in plate, lower right corner: Bruegel Inuent

Inscribed in plate below image, center: TOBLITE Ô PORTE, CAPITA VESTEA, ATTOLLIMINI FORES SEMPITERNE, ET INGREDIETVR REX ILLE GLORIOSVS

caption: Peter van der Heyden (ca. 1530–after 1572; born Antwerp, Belgium; died Berchem, Belgium), after Pieter Bruegel the Elder (ca. 1525–1569; born Breda, Netherlands; died Brussels, Belgium), Published by Hieronymus Cock (1507–1570; born and died  Antwerp, Belgium), Descent of Christ into Limbo, ca. 1551. Engraving; 23.5 x 29.3 cm (plate), 25 x 30.9 cm (sheet). Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888 (x1938-63)
